unnormalised: For example, if you're preparing for the Mumbai Marathon on January 21, 2024, a well-structured plan is crucial. You can’t just wake up one day and run 42 km! Think progressive overload, starting with shorter distances and gradually increasing mileage.

unnormalised: My friend, Rohan, swears by interval training. He's a beast on the cricket field thanks to it! He does sprints with short recovery periods. Something like 400m repeats with 90 seconds rest. Does wonders for his stamina during those long innings.

unnormalised: Don't underestimate the power of rest and recovery either. Overtraining is a real thing, even for seasoned athletes. Make sure to get enough sleep and listen to your body. I remember hearing that P.T. Usha used to focus on this, emphasizing that proper rest after intense training on 15/08/1984 was key to her performance.
